page.title: 15LANGUAGE 03800597
page.content:
Many of the words used by the natives of Rochester are simply{dialect words found in many places in Northumberland There are,however, some words that seem{peculiar to a small area}of which Rochester is part:most relate to weather,farming terms,or animals.
CAPES_top stones of wall. MOWDY_mole CRUT_smallest of litter. WHAUP_curlew CHUNTER_complaining. CUSHAT_woodpigeon DESS_hay cut from stack. OWELED_on its back (sheep). DEEZY_misty,dank. DYKE_dry stone wall. FADS_stock pens. SPIRING_cold dry wind. SHEELIE_chaffinch. STELL_ stone sheepfold. SYKE_small open stream. THRUFFS_large stones through wall. POSSEN_tramping down(hay). THOCKING_panting.
